name: AI Readiness Assessment
description: A diagnostic conversation that uncovers where you are with AI, where the gaps are, and exactly what to do next.

questions.text: What is your current role?
What industry are you in?
What is your company name?
How large is your organization?
How many direct reports do you have?
When you look back at your career journey, what’s the common thread connecting your roles and decisions? How does that inform how you lead today?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: Listen for identity anchors and leadership philosophy. Probe whether their self-narrative is coherent and whether it naturally includes technology/innovation or treats it as separate. Ask ONE follow-up that connects their past to their current AI challenge.

questions.text: What problem did your company originally set out to solve? Now that you’re in it—has the problem turned out to be what you originally thought, or has it morphed into something different?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: Listen for adaptability signals. Do they see the evolving problem as exciting or overwhelming? Probe for how AI might fit into the evolved problem space.

questions.text: When your organization faces a major change, how do you personally show up? Are you the one pushing forward, holding back, or somewhere in between?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: Probe for the gap between how they DESCRIBE their change behavior and what they've ACTUALLY done with AI. If they say they're change leaders, ask for a specific recent example of leading an AI-related change. If they admit hesitation, honor that honesty and explore what's behind it.

questions.text: If you were coaching yourself through AI adoption the way you’d coach a colleague—what advice would you give?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: This reveals the gap between knowing and doing. If their advice is sophisticated, ask: 'Is that advice easy to follow when you're living it?' If their advice is generic, probe deeper into what specifically feels hard about AI adoption.

questions.text: What AI tools did you personally use this week—not your team, you specifically?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: This is the most important reality check. If they give specifics (tool names, use cases), ask about the most sophisticated thing they've done. If vague or none, don't judge—ask what they think is getting in their way. Listen for: tool names, frequency, sophistication level, integration into workflow vs. one-off experiments.

questions.text: What AI tool or approach have you tried that completely missed the mark?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: Failures reveal learning patterns. Ask whether the failure was about the tool itself or about it not understanding their specific domain. People who can articulate WHY something failed are closer to success than people who just say 'it didn't work.'

questions.text: On a scale of 1-10, where would you honestly place your personal AI capability?
questions.subtext: 1 = 'I avoid AI entirely' → 10 = 'I'm teaching others and innovating'
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: After they rate themselves, ask: 'What would need to be true for you to move up two points?' Then challenge gently: 'Are you being fully honest with that number, or is there a gap between what you tell yourself and reality?'

questions.text: Compared to other leaders in your industry, where would you place your AI fluency?
What AI behaviors would your direct reports say they’ve seen from you in the last two weeks?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: This reveals the gap between intention and visible action. Follow up with: 'Is that the example you want to be setting for your team on AI?'

questions.text: If you could have an AI expert sit with you privately for 2 hours—no team, no board, no judgment—what would you want to learn that you’d be embarrassed to ask publicly?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: This is the trust moment. Whatever they share, validate it. Don't rush past it. This answer often reveals the REAL starting point for the engagement. If they deflect with humor or generalities, gently push: 'I mean the thing that keeps you up at night about AI—the question you'd feel silly asking in front of your team.'

questions.text: What percentage of your team is genuinely capable with AI right now? Not interested, not dabbling—actually using it independently to improve their work.
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: After the percentage, ask: 'Is there any AI training or upskilling happening, or is everyone figuring it out on their own?' Low percentage + no training = major selling opportunity for team upskilling.

questions.text: Who on your team is most likely already experimenting with AI—even unofficially? Have you tapped into that?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: Hidden champions are your internal allies for adoption. Ask if they've empowered this person or if the experimentation is happening under the radar.

questions.text: What AI tools do you suspect your team is using that haven’t been officially vetted? Does that concern you?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: Shadow AI reveals both innovation energy AND governance gaps. If they handle sensitive data (customer info, financial, regulatory), probe the compliance risk angle.

questions.text: Who makes technology and AI-related decisions in your organization? Is there a dedicated person, or does it fall to whoever has bandwidth?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: If tech leadership is fractional, part-time, or the founder themselves, this is a constraint. Ask: 'Is that model a constraint on your AI ambitions, or does it work for your stage?' Listen for whether they've outgrown their current tech leadership setup.

questions.text: If you stepped away for a month—how much of how your company actually operates is documented versus exists in people’s heads?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: Low documentation = AI can't be trained on your processes. Ask: 'Who holds the most undocumented institutional knowledge? What would happen if they left tomorrow?'

questions.text: What single process, if it ran 50% faster, would have the biggest impact on your ability to grow?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: This is gold for service recommendations. Follow up with: 'What's currently slowing it down?' and 'Have you tried to fix it before? What happened?'

questions.text: Walk me through your customer journey from first touch to fully onboarded. Where do customers get stuck? Where does your team spend the most time hand-holding?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: Map the friction points. Ask: 'As you scale, which parts of that journey will break first?' This reveals where AI automation has the highest ROI.

questions.text: What decisions regularly get delayed because you’re waiting on information, analysis, or someone’s availability?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: Decision latency is invisible cost. Ask: 'What's the cost of those delays? Can you put a number on it—even roughly?'

questions.text: What repetitive tasks are eating your hours that shouldn’t require your level of attention?
questions.subtext: Estimate the hours per week if you can.
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: This creates the ROI anchor. Push for specific hours: 'Roughly how many hours per week?' Then: 'Why hasn't that been automated or delegated already?' The answer to 'why not' reveals the real blocker.

questions.text: How many different tools does your team use daily? How well do they talk to each other?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: Data silos kill AI potential. Ask: 'What data currently gets manually moved between systems?' Each manual data transfer is an automation candidate.

questions.text: When you want to understand how your business is performing, how do you get that picture? How long does it take to get accurate numbers?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: If getting a performance picture takes more than 5 minutes, there's an AI dashboard opportunity. Ask what metrics matter most and where the data lives.

questions.text: Where do mistakes or quality issues most commonly occur in your operation? Do you catch them proactively or when a customer notices?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: Reactive quality control = AI opportunity for proactive detection. Ask about the cost of quality failures—both direct and reputational.

questions.text: What are the parts of your industry that are still painfully manual or analog, even in 2026?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: This reveals industry-specific AI opportunities. For each pain point, ask: 'Has anyone in your space tried to solve this with AI? What happened?'

questions.text: How does regulation or compliance shape what you can and can’t do with AI in your space?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: Regulation can be a barrier OR a moat. Ask: 'Does compliance slow you down, or does it actually protect you from competitors who can't navigate it?'

questions.text: What’s the biggest market expansion opportunity in front of you right now? What would need to change in your operation to capture it?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: Tie expansion back to AI: 'Could AI help you capture that opportunity faster? What specific capability would you need?'

questions.text: What’s your biggest customer support challenge right now? What percentage of support questions are repetitive?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: High repetitive question percentage = immediate AI chatbot/knowledge base opportunity. Ask: 'If AI could handle 80% of those questions accurately, what would that free up for your team?'

questions.text: What have you learned about how your customers adopt new technology? How would you introduce AI-powered features to them?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: Customer readiness for AI features affects product strategy. Ask about trust dynamics—do their customers trust AI recommendations?

questions.text: What’s the uncomfortable truth about your company’s readiness for AI that everyone thinks but no one says out loud?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: This is where real talk happens. Sit with whatever they say. Don't rush to solve it. Ask: 'What would it take to address that truth head-on?'

questions.text: Where does pushback on AI or new technology come from in your world? Inside your team, from customers, from your industry?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: Map the resistance landscape. Ask: 'What's driving the pushback? Is it fear, lack of understanding, bad past experiences, or something else?'

questions.text: Who do you most urgently need to bring along on the AI journey, and what are their resistance points?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: This identifies the key people who need to be influenced. Ask about specific individuals (without names if they prefer) and what motivates them.

questions.text: If you had to bet your company’s future on one AI-driven transformation—something that would fundamentally change your business—what would that bet be?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: This reveals their AI vision at its boldest. Follow up: 'What would need to be true for that bet to pay off?' and 'What's stopping you from making that bet today?'

questions.text: If your board or investors asked you tomorrow to ‘prove AI investment is worth it’—what evidence would you show them? What question would you hope they don’t ask?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: The 'question they hope isn't asked' reveals the biggest gap. That gap is likely what they need help with most.

questions.text: What problem in your business or industry have you always assumed was unsolvable—that you now wonder if AI might actually crack?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: This surfaces ambition and imagination. Ask: 'What makes AI the key to solving it now versus before?'

questions.text: As AI handles more analytical and administrative work—what uniquely human value do you bring that becomes MORE important, not less?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: This anchors the HMN brand. Ask: 'How are you doubling down on that human value?' This answer often becomes the emotional core of the participant's masterclass experience.

questions.text: Does AI feel like it helps or threatens your core mission? Why?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: Whatever they choose, ask them to elaborate. If 'threatens'—dig into the specific fear. If 'helps'—ask how specifically. The nuance matters more than the category.

questions.text: When you think about AI for your organization—are you primarily thinking about doing what you already do faster and cheaper, or imagining entirely new ways to serve your customers?
How much energy do you personally have right now to drive AI transformation?
Final question: If the best version of yourself were coaching the current version through AI adoption—what would you say?
questions.aiFollowUpPrompt: Let this be reflective. This answer often contains the seed of their transformation narrative. Thank them sincerely for their time and honesty.

scoringDimensions.label: AI Awareness
scoringDimensions.description: Understanding of what AI can do and where it applies

scoringDimensions.label: AI Action
scoringDimensions.description: Actually using AI tools in day-to-day work

scoringDimensions.label: Process Readiness
scoringDimensions.description: How well processes are documented, structured, and automatable

scoringDimensions.label: Strategic Clarity
scoringDimensions.description: Clear vision of where AI fits in business strategy

scoringDimensions.label: Change Energy
scoringDimensions.description: Personal drive and organizational will to transform

scoringDimensions.label: Team Capacity
scoringDimensions.description: Team's ability to adopt and execute AI initiatives

scoringDimensions.label: Mission Alignment
scoringDimensions.description: How well AI adoption aligns with core mission

scoringDimensions.label: Investment Readiness
scoringDimensions.description: Ability to justify and fund AI initiatives
